meanings.definition: To offer a very low price or estimate.
meanings.sent1: He always lowballs the cost of his services to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: She lowballs the value of the antique vase to make a quick sale.
meanings.sent3: The magician lowballs the price of his magic show to trick people into attending.
meanings.sent4: The real estate agent lowballs the property value to make it seem like a great deal.
meanings.sent5: The student lowballs the answer to the math problem, hoping the teacher won't notice.

meanings.definition: A very low offer or estimate.
meanings.sent1: The car salesman made a lowballs offer on the used car.
meanings.sent2: She received a lowballs estimate for the repair of her roof.
meanings.sent3: The lowballs price for the concert tickets seemed too good to be true.
meanings.sent4: His lowballs bid on the painting shocked the art dealer.
meanings.sent5: The company's lowballs proposal was quickly rejected by the client.

meanings.sent1: She constantly lowballs her own abilities, not realizing how talented she is.
meanings.sent2: The critic tends to lowballs the quality of the movies he reviews.
meanings.sent3: The comedian lowballs the importance of his jokes, but they always make people laugh.
meanings.sent4: The coach lowballs the skills of his team, but they end up winning every game.
meanings.sent5: The artist lowballs the significance of her paintings, but they are admired by many.
